page.title: 03INTERVIEW Withiel Farm
page.content: Withiel Farm is right in the middle of the Somerset countryside.It is a modern sheep farm because he does not have the traditional hill breeds,but instead he has{700}'Mules'. The farm covers{320 acres.}One of the main attractions of the open countryside is hardly ever hearing a car. His neighbour lives 100 yards up the road, but he has only seen him 4 or 5 times in 2 years. He used to grow corn, but due to heavy rain in this area, he gave it up. For two months every year,the family go abroad while a farm manager looks after the farm. They make silage twice a year, but straw has to be bought at Williton. For every 1 ram there are 30 ewes. They lamb in mid_March.During Winter the sheep are fed silage and mineral cake.
